setActivity(android.content.ComponentNam.Description: Sets the target activity. A shortcut will be shown along with this activity's icon on the launcher.

setIcon(int).Description: use @B_android#support#v4#content#pm#ShortcutInfoCompat#Builder#setIcon_E@ instead Sets an icon of a shortcut.

setIntent(android.content.Intent).Description: Sets the intent of a shortcut. Alternatively, @B_android#support#v4#content#pm#ShortcutInfoCompat#Builder#setIntents_E@ can be used to launch an activity with other activities in the back stack. This is a mandatory field when publishing a new shortcut. The given intent can contain extras, but these extras must contain values of primitive types in order for the system to persist these values.

setDisabledMessage(java.lang.CharSequenc.Description: Sets the message that should be shown when the user attempts to start a shortcut that is disabled.

setLongLabel(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Sets the text of a shortcut. This field is intended to be more descriptive than the shortcut title. The launcher shows this instead of the short title when it has enough space. The recommend maximum length is 25 characters.

setIcon(android.graphics.Bitmap).Description: use @B_android#support#v4#content#pm#ShortcutInfoCompat#Builder#setIcon_E@ instead Sets an icon of a shortcut.

setIntents(android.content.Intent[]).Description: Sets multiple intents instead of a single intent, in order to launch an activity with other activities in back stack. Use @B_android#app#TaskStackBuilder_E@ to build intents. The last element in the list represents the only intent that doesn't place an activity on the back stack.

setShortLabel(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Sets the short title of a shortcut. This is a mandatory field when publishing a new shortcut. This field is intended to be a concise description of a shortcut. The recommended maximum length is 10 characters.
